text: This week saw us welcome Jens Stoltenberg, Secretary General of NATO, to the Capitol, and continued steps in our fight to improve health care #ForThePeople. That and more is covered in this week’s photo series. https://medium.com/@SpeakerPelosi/madam-speaker-a-behind-the-scenes-look-at-the-u-s-speaker-of-the-house-march-1-5-2019-4b3247138393

As Homeland Security Secretary, Kirstjen Nielsen oversaw the implementation of the Trump Admin’s increasingly toxic anti-immigrant policies. That she is reportedly resigning because she is not extreme enough for the White House’s liking is deeply alarming. https://www.speaker.gov/newsroom/4719/

Health care should be a right—not something out of reach for folks because they don’t make enough money. We need to end the days when any American has to live with fear and stress over an inability to pay to treat an illness. We must move to a Medicare for all system.

It’s absurd that we have to say this in America in 2019: When you turn on the tap in your home, whether it's in Vermont or Iowa or Flint, Michigan, you have a right to expect that the water coming out is clean.

At President Kennedy’s inauguration, I heard him speak of ‘the energy, the faith, the devotion…that will light our country and all who serve it – and the glow from that fire can truly light the world.’  It is inspiring that the award itself is a manifestation of that light.
We need a president who recognizes that white nationalist extremism is a national security threat — and is willing to speak that truth and address it.

Happy Sunday! Excited to say I’m tending to a community garden plot for the next few months :)

Any green-thumbs out with sage🌱 words of advice?

What should I plant? (Ideally at least 1 edible thing but we can do flowers too)
